newsitem.title: PERU: Peru 42-day CDs draw 13.98 pct avg yield at sale. [CORRECTED 23:35 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Peru 42-day CDs draw 13.98 pct avg yield at sale. [CORRECTED 23:35 GMT]

text.p: (Corrects average yield in headline to 13.98 pct from 13.96 pct)

The Central Reserve Bank of Peru said Tuesday it accepted bids for 42-day certificates of deposit (CDs) worth 60.1 (corrects from 50.0) million soles with an effective average annual interest rate of 13.98 (corrects from 13.96) percent.
The bids accepted at the auction BCQZ had a minimum rate of 13.50 percent and a maximum rate of 14.30 percent, the bank said.
The CDs have a September 11 starting date.
At the previous auction on September 5, 42-day CDs drew an average yield of 14.15 percent.
The bank on Tuesday received bids on the CDs totalling 122.77 million soles, it said. It had offered 50.0 million soles of CDs.
The average effective annual interest rate for the certificates serves as an informal indicator for interest rates in the Peruvian financial system.
